net.nemerosa.ontrack.model.buildfilter

Interface BuildFilter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BuildIntervalFilter, DefaultBuildFilter, NamedBuildFilter, StandardBuildFilter

    public interface BuildFilter
    Defines a filter on builds for a branch.

    Implementation note: a BuildFilter instance is created for each query, and can therefore hold instance variables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BuildFilterResult filter(java.util.List<Build> builds, Branch branch, Build build, java.util.function.Supplier<BuildView> buildViewSupplier)
      Actual filter method that is called to filter the build.
      default void init(Branch branch)
      Initialises this filter so it can be used.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        BuildFilterResult filter(java.util.List<Build> builds,
                         Branch branch,
                         Build build,
                         java.util.function.Supplier<BuildView> buildViewSupplier)
        Actual filter method that is called to filter the build.
        Parameters:
        builds - Current list of builds as they have been already accepted by the filter. This filter is free to update this list if needed.
        branch - Branch the filter operates on
        build - Build to filter
        buildViewSupplier - If the filter needs to access the BuildView for this build, it can call this supplier to load it on demand.
        Returns:
        Result of the filter. The goingOn property must be set to true if the filtering must go on with following builds. The accept property must be set to true if the build must be added to the list (note that the filter could add it directly to the list and return false instead)

      • init

        default void init(Branch branch)
        Initialises this filter so it can be used. By default, this does nothing.
        Parameters:
        branch - Branch to use for the filter
